content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can accomplish this:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits 
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, "$(fwu.value) $(fwu.unit)")
end
```

In the above code snippet, we define a `struct` called `FloatWithUnits` with two fields: `value` and `unit`. Then we implement a `show` function that prints the value and unit in the format "value unit". 

Note that this is very basic functionality. In practice, you would probably want to include more complex error checking (e.g., for ensuring that `fwu.value` is a number and not a string, etc.) as well as formatting options (such as using decimal places or commas in the value depending on the unit).
